activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Xavier Allen

Activity:  Waiver of preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:03 PM Defendant Paul Xavier Allen in court by video with attorney Patricia Lynn Arreazola in person.  Intern Margaret Ginocchio by video supervised by David Zarwell by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint reading waived.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:07 PM Defendant Paul Xavier Allen in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David S Olson and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court sets $7500 Signature Bond with conditions:  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
